title: 25 game chat ban because i defended myself???
body:
how come when i report people who tell me disgusting hurtful sexist things nothing happens but when i DEFEND myself i get a chat ban??? this is the second time this has happened. im losing faith in this game. why are the people who **are** the problem and are incredibly toxic not getting in any trouble? how come im the one getting a chat ban with no explanation as to WHY?? Whats going on riot?
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

replies.body:
1) Just because you didn't get a notification doesn't mean they weren't punished, you only get that notification if your report was the final one to cause the punishment, not if it was one of the flags along the way.

2) "Defending" and firing back are different things. If you got a chat restriction, it was most likely justified, but you are welcome to post your chat logs in a post so that people can be the judge of that. Otherwise we can't empathize with what you may or may not have said. 

3) If this is your second time getting a chat ban, you obviously aren't handling people being rude very well. Your best bet would be muting the person, which solves the problem and prevents you being in a flame war that warrants a chat ban.
the first one, ill admit, was my fault, this time though? no. absolutely not. but like i said, if i ever see the chat log (which i havent yet) ill post it here.

My fault on the chat log part, those are only given during bans in email format. Chat restrictions aren't supplied with a chat log. If you want however, if I remember correctly the replay tool has an option to turn on chat during the replay which should pretty much give you a log.

Edit: Not sure why my post attempting to fix a mistake is downvoted.

(i think) Its because of another player telling me that girls shouldnt play, saying im not carrying, yelling at me for feeding every time i died, i died twice mind you, trying to get the other team to report me, ectectect.  
when all i said back was to "stop being so fucking misogyistic" 
then he kept calling me hun and i said "ew gross stop calling me hun" 
i ended up carrying the game and said "get carried noob" 

ive seen significantly worse out of people, so that brings me back to the point of, can i not defend myself?

You would not receive a chat restriction based on the words hun and noob
nor fucking

Remember if you put yourself online, you are responsible for yourself while online

I'm curious how they came to find out your gender.  It would seem to me that a conversation that brings gender into an equation is hard to accomplish

i feel like my name is kind of a dead giveaway for gender but who knows. 
i am responsible for my actions, i understand that.
So whats my name say about me?
ur magical*~

Pretty much this. You don't need to defend yourself, you'll most likely never see the person again, let alone know who they are. It's silly to risk your account being punished to fight against something/someone insignificant.

well, you should be able to see the chat logs after you relog. Unless you've played through all the games already, in which the logs will only be in email (or you can send in a ticket to support and request for them).

You can defend yourself, but it's different than a counter attack. There is a fine line between the both, but most the time, people mistake counter attack as a form of defense. ~~~~
You're only responsible for your own actions, and by the same token only you are responsible for your own actions. What other people do doesn't excuse what you did, two wrongs don't make a right.

Checked you out on op.gg and i'm just gonna throw this out there, due to your current rank of Bronze V, the people you encounter will almost always be one of these things in chat, or a combination of.

1. Mad cause bad
2. Smurfing and/or main got banned and now they're spreading their bullshit in a lower elo
3. un-intelligible screeching

Honestly your best bet is to mute everyone in the game the instant you load in and buy your items. If you want, let them know they've all been muted and to communicate with pings, I promise you, almost nobody in your current elo has anything beneficial to say to anyone else. 

Not meaning to bash you for having a low rank or anything, I was bronze once myself, and I know the struggle, and because of that, seriously just mute everyone.

I highly recommend this. I get tilted really easily, so sometimes I just mute everyone at the start. However, I would leave out the part to communicate with pings, because what usually ends up happening is I get MIA-pinged for the entire game (Riot, can we have a "mute pings" option please?).
